Description: This is a logic entity which will trigger its target after being triggered a specified amount of times. Toggle-trigger and on-trigger will cause it to count up by 1. Off-trigger will cause it to count down by 1. An equivalent of this entity can be created through the usage of [trigger_condition](../trigger_condition) and [trigger_changevalue](../trigger_condition).

keyChoices.choiceDescription: Reset entity Initial value after triggered.
Trigger a target when initial value is higher than limit value.

KeyDescriptions.keyDescription: Set name of {{ entname }} so other entities can trigger it to increase or decrease counter. Depending on trigger use-type: 'On' or 'Toggle'- increase counter by one, 'Off'- decrease counter by one. Can be kill-targeted.
Entity to trigger when counter hits it's limit value, or goes above this limit when 'Fire if over limit' flag is selected. Trigger use-type is 'Toggle'.
Entity to remove when counter hits it's limit value.

Name of the [multisource](../multisource) entity that (temporary) locks this {{ entname }}. If master is specified the {{ entname }} will be disabled and it will not count up/down when triggered. When [multisource](../multisource) entity is triggered/being triggering by all possible inputs, the {{ entname }} will be unlocked. When [multisource](../multisource) lost at least one input signal, the entities becomes locked again.
Starting value of entity. It's also current value when accessing it through other entities like [trigger_copyvalue](../trigger_copyvalue).

Issues: When target is set to ambient_generic, the game_counter need to receive twice more inputs than normal, unless "Fire if over limit" spawnflag is selected.
